job_description:
Join Our Mission to Combat Antimicrobial Resistance!

GARDP (Global Antibiotic Research and Development Partnership), a pioneering not-for-profit organization committed to fighting the global health threat of drug-resistant infections, is on the lookout for a Senior Consultant for US Engagement. This part-time consultancy opportunity offers the chance to play a pivotal role in shaping our engagement and resource mobilization efforts within the United States.

Your Role and Impact:

As our Senior Consultant for US Engagement, you will:
• Develop a Strategy: Craft a comprehensive re-engagement and resource mobilization strategy targeting key stakeholders across the US, including government, NGO, and philanthropy sectors, as well as the media.
• Lead with Influence: Spearhead the strategy's implementation in collaboration with GARDP's Director of External Relations and key staff, focusing on strengthening our mission against antimicrobial resistance (AMR).
• Forge Key Partnerships: Establish and deepen relationships with influential stakeholders to secure future funding and enhance the US's role in the global AMR crisis.
• Shape Our Future: Deliver on critical outputs such as a 12-month engagement strategy, an implementation plan, and insights on the impact of US elections on GARDP's strategic direction.

Why Join GARDP?
• Make a Difference: Contribute to vital work in developing treatments for drug-resistant infections, including STIs, neonatal sepsis, pediatric infections, and serious bacterial infections in adults.
• Be Part of a Global Effort: Work alongside a diverse team of professionals dedicated to ensuring sustainable access to life-saving treatments.
• Drive Change: Use your expertise to influence policy and funding priorities, shaping the global response to AMR.

Requirements

Who We Are Looking For:
• Experienced Leaders: 15-20 years in external affairs or resource mobilization, with a proven track record in fundraising.
• Strategic Thinkers: Advanced degree holders with a deep understanding of global health, medical innovation, and access to medicines.
• Collaborative Innovators: Individuals who excel in multicultural, multi-location settings and are committed to making an impact.

Location & Term:
• Based in Washington, DC, with occasional travel. This consultancy spans approximately 60 days between April and December 2024.

Ready to Apply?

If you're eager to leverage your expertise to make a tangible impact on global health, we want to hear from you!
• Please submit your application using the online form
• Accepting applications until March 22nd 2024 at 5pm CET
• All applications will be reviewed after closing date

APPLY NOW and join us in our fight against AMR!
